title: Landaluce, Eubanks, Garin earn Australian Open qualifying wins
description: Martin Landaluce, Cristian Garin and Christopher Eubanks starred on Day 1 of qualifying for this year’s Australian Open. #NextGenATP Spaniard Landaluce moved past Belgian Raphael Collignon 6-3, 6-3 to reach the second round of qualifying. The 18-year-old is aiming to make his major debut and will next play James Trotter after the Japanese star defeated Briton Daniel Evans 6-4, 3-6, 6-3. American Eubanks beat Frenchman Hugo Grenier 7-6(1), 7-5. Eubanks reached the second round at the AO in 2023 and 2024. Garin reached the third round in Melbourne in 2022 and started this year’s campaign with a 6-3, 6-1 win against Bolivian Murkel Dellien. The former Top 20 star in the PIF ATP Rankings will meet Laslo Djere in the second round. The Serbian beat Gustavo Heide 6-3, 6-1. [ATP APP] In other action, Croatian Duje Ajdukovic defeated former Top 10 star Richard Gasquet 7-6(4), 6-3, while Aleksandar Kovacevic 7-6(5), 6-4 overcame Andrea Collarini. Francesco Passarro defeated Guilo Zeppieri 6-3, 7-6(3) and Hugo Dellien beat Maximilian Marterer 6-3, 6-3. Americans Brandon Holt and Mackenzie McDonald advanced. Holt beat Gianluca Mager 7-6(6), 6-2 and McDonald overcame Aussie Bolt 6-2, 6-2. View full results here. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

The former Top 20 star in the PIF ATP Rankings will meet Laslo Djere in the second round. The Serbian beat Gustavo Heide 6-3, 6-1. Francesco Passarro defeated Guilo Zeppieri 6-3, 7-6(3) and Hugo Dellien beat Maximilian Marterer 6-3, 6-3. Americans Brandon Holt and Mackenzie McDonald advanced. Holt beat Gianluca Mager 7-6(6), 6-2 and McDonald overcame Aussie Bolt 6-2, 6-2. View full results here.
html:
Australian Open

Gasquet falls in final AO

January 06, 2025

Getty Images

Christopher Eubanks in action (file photo). By ATP Staff

Martin Landaluce, Cristian Garin and Christopher Eubanks starred on Day 1 of qualifying for this year’s Australian Open.

#NextGenATP Spaniard Landaluce moved past Belgian Raphael Collignon 6-3, 6-3 to reach the second round of qualifying. The 18-year-old is aiming to make his major debut and will next play James Trotter after the Japanese star defeated Briton Daniel Evans 6-4, 3-6, 6-3.

American Eubanks beat Frenchman Hugo Grenier 7-6(1), 7-5. Eubanks reached the second round at the AO in 2023 and 2024.

Garin reached the third round in Melbourne in 2022 and started this year’s campaign with a 6-3, 6-1 win against Bolivian Murkel Dellien. The former Top 20 star in the PIF ATP Rankings will meet Laslo Djere in the second round. The Serbian beat Gustavo Heide 6-3, 6-1.

In other action, Croatian Duje Ajdukovic defeated former Top 10 star Richard Gasquet 7-6(4), 6-3, while Aleksandar Kovacevic 7-6(5), 6-4 overcame Andrea Collarini. Francesco Passarro defeated Guilo Zeppieri 6-3, 7-6(3) and Hugo Dellien beat Maximilian Marterer 6-3, 6-3.

Americans Brandon Holt and Mackenzie McDonald advanced. Holt beat Gianluca Mager 7-6(6), 6-2 and McDonald overcame Aussie Bolt 6-2, 6-2.

View full results here.
